intro: Hylodesmum podocarpum subsp. podocarpum, commonly known as the narrowleaf hylodesmum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, adapting well to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
